docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept.l2 (AP).--Horacio Oyhanarte, who was Foreign Minister in the Cabinet of former President Hipolito Irigoyen of Argentina, arrived in Montevideo today from Buenos Aires and gave The Associated Press a graphic account of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept.l2 (AP).--Horacio Oyhanarte, who was Foreign Minister in the Cabinet of former President Hipolito Irigoyen of Argentina, arrived in Montevideo today from Buenos Aires and gave The Associated Press a graphic account of the Argentine revolution.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14.--The value of United States exports of automotive products during July registered a decrease of nearly 17 per cent, the Department of Commerce announced today in a survey of the industry, amounting to $18,977,189.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14.--The value of United States exports of automotive products during July registered a decrease of nearly 17 per cent, the Department of Commerce announced today in a survey of the industry, amounting to $18,977,189.

headline.main: JULY AUTO EXPORTS 62% BELOW 1929; $18,977,189 Total Compares With $22,790,355 in June, a Decline of 17 Per Cent. 46% OFF FOR HALF YEAR Drop in Complete Units Was 78 Per Cent in July, as Against Year Ago, and in Parts 10 Per Cent.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Sept. 15.--Following a meeting between Aristide Briand and Arthur Henderson this morning, it is expected that discussion of the project of a European Federation will be continued for another full year before even the foundation stone can be...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Sept. 15.--Following a meeting between Aristide Briand and Arthur Henderson this morning, it is expected that discussion of the project of a European Federation will be continued for another full year before even the foundation stone can be laid for that edifice.
docs.abstract: Result of Briand-Henderson conf believed to be that League will appt special com to study possibilities and rept to next Assembly

headline.main: BRITISH FORCE DELAY OF PAN-EUROPE PLAN TILL NEXT ASSEMBLY; Special League Committee Will Study Project and Report on It in 1931. NON-EUROPEANS APPROVE They Praise Briand's Scheme, but Insist Authority of Geneva Must Rule. HUNGARY URGES DISARMING Count Apponyl Demands All Nations Keep Promise They Made atSigning of Peace Treaties. Few Oppose Special Committee. BRITISH FORCE DELAY ON PAN-EUROPE PLAN American Example Cited.
